content: materials 4mm hook 8ply/dk yarn in various colours i have used three colour pallets for this blanket country victoria australia high low = 14 colours ranging from -1 to 40+ deg c 3deg increments rainfall = 5 shades of brown or greys ranging from cream to chocolate no rain 1-7mm 8-14mm 15-21mm 22+ month = 12 colours or you could do 4 seasons each motif measures approximately 3 5 inch 9cm amount of yarn required will vary for different regions you will need more for middle of the range temperatures and less for extreme temperatures instructions for borders are not included barooga temperature blanket ©kaye adolphson 2024 hexagon motif round 1 = rainfall round 2 = low temperature round 3 = high temperature round 4 = month make 4ch and join with a slip_stitch to form a ring round 1 3ch 11tr into ring slip_stitch to 3rd chain 12tr round 2 3ch 1tr in top of turning chain 2tr in each treble_crochet to end slip_stitch to 3rd chain 24tr round 3 3ch 1tr in top of turning chain 1tr in each of the next 3tr 3tr in next treble_crochet 5 times 1tr in each of the next 3tr 1tr in base of turning chain slip_stitch to 3rd chain round 4 1ch 3dc in top of turning chain 1dc in each of the next 5tr 3dc in next treble_crochet 5 times 1dc in each of the next 5tr slip_stitch to 1st chain fasten_off leaving enough yarn to sew together 3 sides approx 45cm barooga temperature blanket ©kaye adolphson 2024 half hexagon motif make 4ch and join with a slip_stitch to form a ring round 1 3ch 6tr into the ring turn round 2 3ch 1tr into 1st treble_crochet 2tr into each of the next 5tr 1tr into top of turning chain turn round 3 3ch 1tr into 1st treble_crochet 1tr in each of the next 3tr 3tr in next treble_crochet 2 times 1tr in each of the next 3tr 2tr into top of turning chain turn round 4 1ch 1dc into each of the next 6tr 3dc in next treble_crochet 1dc into each of the next 5tr 3dc in next treble_crochet 1dc into each of the next 5tr 1dc into top of turning chain fasten_off leaving enough yarn to sew together 3 sides approx 45cm to make up sew hexagons by placing right sides together and picking up the back loop on each motif join down one side and leave tail for joining sides of subsequent hexagons barooga temperature blanket ©kaye adolphson 2024 slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain 0 double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet treble fill in the dips
